intro: Camoensia brevicalyx, commonly known as the short-lobed camoensia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white and pale pink. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and its stems are typically woody and branched. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
